cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles south of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest toward the central Texas coast, then forecast to slow, turn north and northeast hugging the upper Texas coastline and Galveston Bay area before sliding inland toward Louisiana mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just north of Port O’Connor, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA (includes Galveston Bay and Texas City area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and upper Texas coast including Matagorda Peninsula, Galveston Bay, and southwest Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Sustained 40–60 mph tropical-storm-force winds with higher gusts likely in and around Texas City beginning later Monday morning and persisting into Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground level possible inside Galveston Bay, including Texas City dike and industrial waterfronts
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 6–12 in, isolated 15 in totals possible leading to flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous rip currents, and prolonged elevated seas that could disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations
